commit_scope: Unblock start-gate by treating main maintainability workflow failures as advisory and add clawwork executor alias integration across routing, telemetry, provider readiness, docs, and tests.
evidence_refs: cd api && pytest -q tests/test_openclaw_executor_integration.py tests/test_agent_executor_policy.py tests/test_agent_usage_tracking_api.py tests/test_automation_usage_api.py tests/test_agent_runner_tool_failure_telemetry.py

python3 -m py_compile scripts/start_gate.py api/app/services/agent_routing_service.py api/app/services/agent_service.py api/app/services/automation_usage_service.py api/scripts/agent_runner.py api/app/services/agent_execution_service.py
python3 scripts/start_gate.py (validated from temporary clean worktree)

commands: cd api && pytest -q tests/test_openclaw_executor_integration.py tests/test_agent_executor_policy.py tests/test_agent_usage_tracking_api.py tests/test_automation_usage_api.py tests/test_agent_runner_tool_failure_telemetry.py

python3 -m py_compile scripts/start_gate.py api/app/services/agent_routing_service.py api/app/services/agent_service.py api/app/services/automation_usage_service.py api/scripts/agent_runner.py api/app/services/agent_execution_service.py

e2e_validation.expected_behavior_delta: Thread startup gates no longer hard-block on the scheduled maintainability workflow while all other failing workflows still block, and executor/provider handling accepts clawwork as an alias of openclaw across route selection and telemetry attribution.
test_flows: api:/api/agent/route with executor=clawwork resolves to openclaw tier/model
api:/api/automation/usage/provider-validation infers openclaw validation when runtime metadata uses clawwork executor/model prefixes

phase_gate.reason: Awaiting commit, CI, and public deploy verification
